  • Classes in pt.ist.fenixframework used by pt.ist.fenixframework 
    Class and Description
    Atomic
    Syntactic sugar for enabling a programmer to specify that a given method should be executed within a transaction.
    Atomic.TxMode 
    CallableWithoutException
    This interface represents the same behaviour as the Callable interface, except that its call method does not throw a cheched exception.
    CommitListener
    Represents a listener that will be notified whenever a Transaction is committed.
    Config
    An instance of the Config class bundles together the initialization parameters used by the Fenix Framework.
    DomainBPlusTreeData
    A auxiliary object to keep the size slot for a DomainBPlusTreeJVSTM.
    DomainBPlusTreeData_Base 
    DomainBPlusTreeJVSTM
    A DomainBPlusTree with a JVSTM-specific optimization to obtain the size().
    DomainBPlusTreeJVSTM_Base 
    DomainFenixFrameworkRoot
    The DomainFenixFrameworkRoot is a singleton root object that is related to all the DomainMetaClasses in the system.
    The initialize method is called during the initialization of the FenixFramework.
    DomainFenixFrameworkRoot_Base 
    DomainMetaClass
    A DomainMetaClass is the domain entity that represents a class existing in the application's domain model, declared in the DML.
    These DomainMetaClasses are created or deleted only during the FenixFramework initialization.
    DomainMetaClass_Base 
    DomainMetaObject
    Each domain object is associated with one DomainMetaObject, which is a representation of the domain object inside the fenix-framework domain.
    DomainMetaObject_Base 
    DomainObject
    All domain objects implement this interface.
    DomainRoot 
    DomainRoot_Base 
    MultiConfig
    Stores multiple Fenix Framework Configurations.
    NoDomainMetaObjects
    THIS ANNOTATION IS FOR INTERNAL USE OF THE FENIX-FRAMEWORK ONLY.
    Transaction
    Fenix Framework's Interface for Transactions.
    TransactionManager
    Fenix Framework's interface for all Transaction Managers.
